text: The 1929 Preakness Stakes was the 54th running of the $62,325 Preakness Stakes horse race for three-year-old Thoroughbreds. The race took place on May 10, 1929 and was run 8 days before the Kentucky Derby. Ridden by Louis Schaefer, Dr. Freeland won the race by one length over runner-up Minotaur. The race was run on a track rated fast in a final time of 2:01 3/5.Daily Racing Form May 11, 1929 article titled "Dr. Freeland's Preakness: Spectacular Finish" Retrieved September 2, 2018 New York Times May 11, 1929 article titled "Dr. Freeland Wins Preakness" Retrieved September 2, 2018 == Payout == The 54th Preakness Stakes Payout Schedule {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font- size:90%" |- ! width="58px" | Program Number ! width="110px" | Horse Name ! width="58px" | Win ! width="58px" | Place ! width="58px" | Show |- | align=center|5 | Dr. Freeland | align=center| $9.70 | align=center| $5.60 | align=center| $6.10 |- | align=center|9 | Minotaur | align=center| - | align=center| $11.40 | align=center| $8.30 |- | align=center|10 | African | align=center| | align=center| | align=center| $6.10 |} == The full chart == Daily Racing Form charts:Daily Racing Form May 11, 1929 Preakness Stakes results chart Retrieved September 2, 2018 {| class="wikitable sortable" | border="2" cellpadding="1" style="border-collapse: collapse; font-size:90%" |- ! width="30px" |Finish Position ! width="30px" |Margin (lengths) ! width="30px" |Post Position ! width="90px" |Horse name ! width="110px" |Jockey ! width="125px" |Trainer ! width="180px" |Owner ! width="40px" |Post Time Odds ! width="40px" |Purse Earnings |- | align=center|1st | align=center|0 | align=center|6 |Dr. Freeland |Louis Schaefer |Thomas J.
